cyclone.name: NATE
cyclone.current_location: about 25 miles SSW of San Andres Island, or 210 miles SSE of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to continue northwest across Nicaragua and Honduras, then turn north-northwest across the north-western Caribbean and Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast of the United States.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi River Delta / southeastern Louisiana coast (close to Plaquemines Parish)

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A – current watches limited to Nicaragua/Honduras coastline
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Sandy Bay Sirpi, Nicaragua to Punta Castilla, Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central America (Nicaragua/Honduras) Thursday–Friday, then Yucatán Peninsula, western Cuba, and north-central U.S. Gulf Coast (LA–AL) Saturday-Sunday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–63 kt) increasingly likely late Saturday night through Sunday; a low but increasing chance (≈8%) of 50 kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for 3–6 ft surge along the lower Mississippi River Delta and Breton/Barataria Bays as the system approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands of 4–8 inches possible Sunday–Monday with localized higher amounts, leading to flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands and possible temporary navigation restrictions on the Mississippi River.
